com.gensym.message
Class ProcessTrace

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.gensym.message.ProcessTrace
public class ProcessTrace
extends Object
implements MessageGenerator

A ProcessTrace can be used to report trace messages for an identified "process". An instance of a ProcessTrace could be passed/utilized by the collection of instances that make up a given java process or task allowing trace messages to be grouped per process. Provides convenience methods for sending messages while tracing. NOTE: Does not generate garbage in the arguments to calls to report unless these calls are not made when tracing is off. The convenience report methods are provided to help avoid unnecessary garbage in complex tracing statements.

Since Tracing should not affect the normal operation of an application, the methods in this class will not throw exceptions.

The following shows a typical usage of this class.: 

 // DECLARATIONS:
 private static final Resource i18nTrace =
         Trace.getBundle("com.gensym.foo.TraceMessages");
 private static final MessageKey traceKey =
         Trace.registerMessageKey("com.gensym.foo", MyClass.class);
 ...
 // CALL IN CODE BODY
 processTrace.send(this, 5, traceKey, i18nTrace, "interestingThingHappened",
              arg1, arg2, arg3);
When adding tracing to your own application, it is necessary to add a MessageListener that will receive the Trace messages and print them out in whatever manner is appropriate for your application. A simple implemention of MessageListener can be seen in com.gensym.message.TraceOut.

See Also:
TraceOut

Method Detail

getProcessTrace

public static ProcessTrace getProcessTrace(String processID)
Return a ProcessTrace for a given processID. A ProcessTrace is created if one does not exist for a give processID.
Parameters:
processID - a non-null processID.

setProcessTrace

public static void setProcessTrace(ProcessTrace processTrace,
                                   Object source,
                                   Enumeration enum)
Convenience method for setting the ProcessTrace on an Enumeration of TraceableProcessObjects.
Parameters:
processTrace - The possibly-null ProcessTrace to set.
enum - An Enumeration of objects that if implement TraceableProcessObject, will be called with setProcessTrace(processTrace).

getProcessTraces

public static Enumeration getProcessTraces()
Return an Enumeration of the ProcessTraces that have been created in this VM.
Returns:
A non-null Enumeration of ProcessTraces.

addMessageListener

public void addMessageListener(MessageListener listener,
                               String key,
                               Class classKey,
                               int level)
Subscribe a MessageListener to receive Trace messages from this Traceable object.
Specified by:
addMessageListener in interface MessageGenerator
Parameters:
listener - The non-null MessageListener.
key - A non-null String detailing the trace topic the subscriber is interested in.
classKey - A non-null Class detailing the Class of the trace message generators that the subscriber is interested in.
level - An int detailing the level at which level of messages the subscriber wises to to receive messages.

removeMessageListener

public void removeMessageListener(MessageListener listener)
Remove a MessageListener from subscribing to Trace messages.
Specified by:
removeMessageListener in interface MessageGenerator
Parameters:
listener - The non-null MessageListener no-longer interested in messages.

getTraceOn

public boolean getTraceOn()
Return the trace status of this ProcessTrace.
Returns:
True if messages sent to the ProcessTrace are processed further and forwarded to subscribers.

setTraceOn

public void setTraceOn(boolean traceOn)
Set the current trace status of this ProcessTrace.
Parameters:
traceOn - set TRUE for messages sent to the ProcessTrace to be forewarded to interesed subscribers. Set FALSE for no processing and minmial overhead.

getProcessID

public String getProcessID()
Get the process ID for this ProcessTrace.
Returns:
The non-null processID for this ProcessTrace.

send

public boolean send(Object source,
                    int level,
                    MessageKey key,
                    Resource res,
                    String message)
Send a tracing event if tracing is on. The remaining signatures of send are convenience methods that also allow for less generation of garbage.
Parameters:
level - the level of verbosity associated with this message.
key - the special key associated with this tracing method
res - the resource used to translate the message
message - the key for looking up the message in the given Resource
args - the arguments to be formatted into the message specified by message NOTE: the toString() method is called on the elements of this array if a message is to be sent.

exception

public void exception(Object source,
                      Throwable t,
                      String message)
Prints out the message, the t.getMessage(), t.printStackTrace() and a Thread.dumpStack(), to provide maximum debugging information. Only does these things when tracing is on
